comments:
When run as JUnit test, the following class causes the stacktrace below, but 
is working perfectly well when refactored i.e. changing the class name and/or the package name 
(attached workspace contains an example with alternate class name and alternate package name).

Only this specific combination of package name and class name causes the problem!

package north.igloo.oodbms;
import junit.framework.TestCase;
public class FeatureTest extends TestCase {
	
	public void testDummy () {
		fail ("Failure");
	}

}

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: junit/framework/TestCase
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass0(Native Method)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:502)
	at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(SecureClassLoader.java:123)
	at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(URLClassLoader.java:250)
	at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(URLClassLoader.java:54)
	at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:193)
	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
	at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:186)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:299)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:292)
	at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:265)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:255)
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.loadSuiteClass(RemoteTestRunner.java:359)
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.getTest(RemoteTestRunner.java:313)
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.runTests(RemoteTestRunner.java:370)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.run(RemoteTestRunner.java:277)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.main(RemoteTestRunner.java:168)

Created an attachment (id=5311)
workspace with simplest project to test the bug.

Problem is more important than it seems at first analysis.

The example attached represents the smallest example of the problem, but we try to fix 
temporarily the problem by renaming our FeatureTest in our "real" workpace... It solves the 
problem for this file, but other names also causes problem... and renaming them didn't solve the 
problem in all the cases...

So I think the archive is a good case to solve the bug, but the described case is not the only one 
that can occur and it seems the problem is much more important.

Another problem is that it seems that the workspace has been corrupted in a certain way because 
switching back to 2.1 doesn't solve the problem.

Hope you'll find the solution (or at least a solution that could help us to fix our workspace asap).

Cannot reproduce the problem with the attached debug project on Windows using 
the SUN JDK 1.4.1.

Can you try to reproduce the problem in a fresh workspace, you mention that it 
got corrupted.

As another experiment can you run the tests as an ordinary Java application 
using the junit.TextRunner. To do so add the following main method to 
FeatureTest.java:
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		TestRunner.run(FeatureTest.class);
	}

Select FeatureTest and execute Run As>Java Application

I am having the same problem with 3.0.1 and 3.0.2 on Mac OS X (tiger) running java 1.4.2_07.  I can't run 
any of my old jnuit test cases (I'm not sure when they stopped working).  If I refactor->rename the class/
file it works fine.  If I change the name back to the old name.  It doesn't work again.  (Even if I do a clean/
rebuild between renames).

I am having a similar problem running Version: 3.1.1 Build id: M20050929-0840 on Windows XP running Java 1.5. The tests run using a main method. When run inside Junit I get the NoClassDefFoundError even though the project compiler has no classpath problem. 

Other tests run with no problem but tests that reference a certain .jar will not run. The compiler has not problem finding and using the classes in the same .jar file. Renaming the .jar does not resolve the issue.
Moving back to the JDT/UI inbox
Can you still see this in 3.2? We improved error reporting and the launching code is new.
